summary.para: The OpenPersonalTrustDBDialog function displays the Certificates dialog box. Note This function has no associated header file or import library. You must define the function yourself and use the and functions to dynamically link to Wintrust.dll.

param.name: hwndParent
param.para: The handle of the parent window for the dialog box. If this parameter is NULL, the dialog box has no parent.

returns.para: Returns nonzero if the dialog box was opened successfully or zero otherwise.

summary.para: The OpenPersonalTrustDBDialogEx function displays the Certificates dialog box. Note This function has no associated header file or import library. You must define the function yourself and use the and functions to dynamically link to Wintrust.dll.

param.name: hwndParent
param.para: The handle of the parent window for the dialog box. If this parameter is NULL, the dialog box has no parent.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A set of flags that modify the behavior of this function. This can be zero or the following value.

description.para: Only display the Trusted Publisher tab. By default, all of the user interface tabs are displayed and the Trusted Publisher tab is initially selected.

returns.para: Returns nonzero if the dialog box was opened successfully or zero otherwise.

summary.para: The WintrustAddDefaultForUsage function specifies the default usage identifier and callback information for a provider.

param.name: pszUsageOID
param.para: Pointer to a string that contains the identifier.

param.name: psDefUsage
param.para: Pointer to a structure that contains callback information.

returns.para: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; FALSE if the function fails. If the function fails, call the function to determine the reason for failure.

remarks.para: If the provider uses this function and requires any of the callback data, the provider must completely fill out the structure.
The usage and callback information can be retrieved by calling the function.

summary.para: The WintrustGetDefaultForUsage function retrieves the default usage identifier and callback information.

param.name: dwAction
param.para: Action to perform. This can be one of the following values. For more information, see Remarks.

description.para: Allocate memory and fill the structure pointed to by the psUsage parameter.
Free all memory allocated during a previous call to this function by specifying DWACTION_ALLOCANDFILL for this parameter.

param.name: pszUsageOID
param.para: Pointer to a string that contains the identifier.

param.name: psUsage
param.para: Pointer to a structure that contains callback information to be retrieved.

returns.para: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; FALSE if the function fails. If the function fails, call the function to determine the reason for failure.

remarks.para: Call this function once with the dwAction parameter set to DWACTION_ALLOCANDFILL to allocate memory and fill a structure with information. Call this function again with the dwAction parameter set to DWACTION_FREE to free the allocated memory.
The default usage and callback information for a provider is registered by calling the function.

summary.para: The WintrustGetRegPolicyFlags function retrieves policy flags for a policy provider. Note This function has no associated import library. You must use the and functions to dynamically link to Wintrust.dll.

param.name: pdwPolicyFlags
param.para: This parameter can be a bitwise combination of one or more of the following values.

description.para: Trust any test certificate.
Check any test certificate for validity.
Use expiration date.
Do revocation check.
If the source is offline, trust any individual certificates.
If the source is offline, trust any commercial certificates.
If the source is offline, trust any individual certificates. Do not use the user interface (UI).
If the source is offline, trust any commercial certificates. Do not use the checking UI.
Turn off verification of version 1.0 certificates.
Ignore time stamp revocation checks.
Allow only items in personal trust database.

summary.para: The WintrustSetDefaultIncludePEPageHashes function sets the default setting that determines whether page hashes are included when creating subject interface package (SIP) indirect data for PE files.
This setting is only used if neither the SPC_EXC_PE_PAGE_HASHES_FLAG or the SPC_INC_PE_PAGE_HASHES_FLAG flag is specified in the dwFlags parameter of the SignerSignEx function.
This function has no associated import library. You must use the and functions to dynamically link to Wintrust.dll.

param.name: fIncludePEPageHashes
param.para: Determines whether page hashes are included when creating SIP indirect data for PE files. If this parameter is nonzero, page hashes are included. If this parameter is zero, page hashes are not included. The value is zero by default.

remarks.para: This setting applies to each instance of Wintrust.dll.

summary.para: The WintrustSetRegPolicyFlags function sets policy flags for a policy provider. Note This function has no associated import library. You must use the and functions to dynamically link to Wintrust.dll.

param.name: dwPolicyFlags
param.para: This parameter can be a bitwise combination of one or more of the following values.

description.para: Trust any test certificate.
Check any test certificate for validity.
Do not check the expiration date.
Do not check revocation.
If the source is offline, trust any individual certificates.
If the source is offline, trust any commercial certificates.
If the source is offline, trust any individual certificates. Do not use the user interface (UI).
If the source is offline, trust any commercial certificates. Do not use the checking UI.
Turn off verification of version 1.0 certificates.
Ignore time stamp revocation checks.
Allow only items in personal trust database.

returns.para: Returns nonzero if the policy flags were set successfully or zero otherwise.
